metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0412 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 6u85, 7u72, and 8u25 allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via vectors related to JAX-WS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-demo - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-source - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-source - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1').
